thread.title: Zerto Expands Executive Leadership Team and Builds on Record-Breaking Growth with Appointment of Chief Revenue Officer

author: cnbc.com
title: Zerto Expands Executive Leadership Team and Builds on Record-Breaking Growth with Appointment of Chief Revenue Officer
text:
BOSTON, April 11, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Zerto , an industry leader for IT resilience, today announced the appointment of Ed Carter as chief revenue officer . The role will focus on leading Zerto’s global sales team and building on this year’s record-breaking growth.
Zerto’s total cloud and enterprise sales in Q1 2018 have far surpassed total cloud and enterprise sales in Q1 2017. Carter joins Zerto to build on this momentum. He and the sales team will focus on acquiring new customers, growing enterprise and existing accounts and building Zerto’s partner GTM strategy to increase strategic partner revenue and deepen relationships across the company’s partner ecosystem. Carter will also be instrumental in an aggressive growth strategy as Zerto continues to build itself into a world-class company.
Carter’s experience spans F200 companies to high-growth start-ups. Most recently, Carter was at Sprinklr, where he was senior vice president of field operations and drove cross-functional GTM strategy for sales, pre-sales, enablement and success teams. Prior to Sprinklr, he was senior vice president of Americas sales for VCE, a division of Dell EMC, formed by Cisco, EMC and VMware, that became the global market leader in converged / hyper-converged infrastructure solutions, achieving the 3rd-fastest ever attainment of $1 billion in annual sales. While at VCE, he was instrumental in driving both operational excellence and sales productivity. Carter has also held sales leadership roles at IBM and Cognos, where his teams consistently attained significant YoY growth.
In addition to experiencing tremendous sales growth, Zerto’s channel program has also expanded over the last 15 months, with the introduction of many new partners, such as Sungard Availability Services and Insight Direct, as well as expansion of Zerto’s partnership with IBM, now serving as the replication engine of the IBM resiliency DRaaS solution , and Microsoft, to deliver multi-cloud IT resilience. Plus, the company more than doubled the number of partners certified on selling and delivering the Zerto platform. Underpinning this growth are two recent awards Zerto has received from top channel industry publication CRN, one of which names Zerto’s Director of Global Alliances Peter Kerr as a CRN 2018 Channel Chief and the second, which calls out Zerto as a 5-Star Cloud Vendor in CRN’s 2018 Partner Program Guide .
Supporting Quote: s
“Ed will be an incredible asset to the Zerto team, bringing us valuable enterprise sales experience and a proven track record in sales strategies and leadership,” said Ziv Kedem, CEO, Zerto. “We were drawn to Ed because he’s proven himself to be successful at every level and has a reputation of making those around him better. He’s not afraid to raise the bar and challenge himself and his teams to achieve lofty goals. Ed is a great addition to the Zerto family, and we welcome him with enthusiasm during this exciting period of growth.”
About Zerto
Zerto helps customers accelerate IT transformation by eliminating the risk and complexity of modernization and cloud adoption. By replacing multiple legacy solutions with a single IT Resilience Platform, Zerto is changing the way disaster recovery, data protection and cloud are managed. With enterprise scale, Zerto’s software platform delivers continuous availability for an always-on customer experience while simplifying workload mobility to protect, recover and move applications freely across hybrid and multi-clouds. Zerto is trusted by over 6,000 customers globally and is powering resiliency offerings for Microsoft Azure, IBM Cloud, AWS, Sungard AS and more than 350 cloud services providers.
Learn more at Zerto.com or register today to join us in Boston at ZertoCON in May.
